subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit
msgSnippet: Just that I write my java (tests and all) from a text editor and I have noticed from what people say that they don t all hand-write tests and I was wondering
messageBody:
Just that I write my java (tests and all) from a text editor and I have
noticed from what people say that they don't all hand-write tests and I was
wondering what (or how much) the IDE does for you?

Andoni.

-----Original Message-----
From: John Clarke [mailto:john@...]
Sent: 21 December 2001 12:24
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit

just how it's installed and used, for example the implementation in Jbuilder
is different to Visual Age...
?

-----Original Message-----
From: Andoni O'Conchubhair [mailto:andoni.oconchubhair@...]
Sent: 21 December 2001 12:01
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit


What do you mean by 'it depends on your IDE'????
Can you explain this?

Andoni.


-----Original Message-----
From: John Clarke [mailto:john@...]
Sent: 21 December 2001 12:06
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit

sid,
it depends on your IDE so as Bernd says ...
see the papers on www.junit.org which are quite helpful.
john

-----Original Message-----
From: Bernd Proissl [mailto:lists@...]
Sent: 21 December 2001 11:56
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] how do i start using Junit


> can any one help me out.
> ia'm going for a java exam and i need to test my code which i decided
> i'll do using JUNIT.
> can anyone help me out in that.

see the papers on www.junit.org

Bernd
